These are also proverbs<S>4912</S> of Solomon<S>8010</S>, which the men<S>582</S> of Hezekiah<S>2396</S> king<S>4428</S> of Judah<S>3063</S> copied out<S>6275</S>.
It is the glory<S>3519</S> of God<S>430</S> to conceal<S>5641</S> a thing<S>1697</S>: but the honour<S>3519</S> of kings<S>4428</S> is to search out<S>2713</S> a matter<S>1697</S>.
The heaven<S>8064</S> for height<S>7312</S>, and the earth<S>776</S> for depth<S>6011</S>, and the heart<S>3820</S> of kings<S>4428</S> is unsearchable<S>2714</S>. <sup>is: Heb. there is no searching</sup>
Take away<S>1898</S> the dross<S>5509</S> from the silver<S>3701</S>, and there shall come forth<S>3318</S> a vessel<S>3627</S> for the finer<S>6884</S>.
Take away<S>1898</S> the wicked<S>7563</S> from before<S>6440</S> the king<S>4428</S>, and his throne<S>3678</S> shall be established<S>3559</S> in righteousness<S>6664</S>.
Put not forth<S>1921</S> thyself in the presence<S>6440</S> of the king<S>4428</S>, and stand<S>5975</S> not in the place<S>4725</S> of great<S>1419</S> men: <sup>Put: Heb. Set not out thy glory</sup>
For better<S>2896</S> it is that it be said<S>559</S> unto thee, Come up<S>5927</S> hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower<S>8213</S> in the presence<S>6440</S> of the prince<S>5081</S> whom thine eyes<S>5869</S> have seen<S>7200</S>.
Go not forth<S>3318</S> hastily<S>4118</S> to strive<S>7378</S>, lest thou know not what to do<S>6213</S> in the end<S>319</S> thereof, when thy neighbour<S>7453</S> hath put thee to shame<S>3637</S>.
Debate<S>7378</S> thy cause<S>7379</S> with thy neighbour<S>7453</S> himself; and discover<S>1540</S> not a secret<S>5475</S> to another<S>312</S>: <sup>a secret: or, the secret of</sup>
Lest he that heareth<S>8085</S> it put thee to shame<S>2616</S>, and thine infamy<S>1681</S> turn not away<S>7725</S>.
A word<S>1697</S> fitly<S>212</S> <S>655</S> spoken<S>1696</S> is like apples<S>8598</S> of gold<S>2091</S> in pictures<S>4906</S> of silver<S>3701</S>. <sup>fitly: Heb. spoken upon his wheels</sup>
As an earring<S>5141</S> of gold<S>2091</S>, and an ornament<S>2481</S> of fine gold<S>3800</S>, so is a wise<S>2450</S> reprover<S>3198</S> upon an obedient<S>8085</S> ear<S>241</S>.
As the cold<S>6793</S> of snow<S>7950</S> in the time<S>3117</S> of harvest<S>7105</S>, so is a faithful<S>539</S> messenger<S>6735</S> to them that send<S>7971</S> him: for he refresheth<S>7725</S> the soul<S>5315</S> of his masters<S>113</S>.
Whoso<S>376</S> boasteth<S>1984</S> himself of a false<S>8267</S> gift<S>4991</S> is like clouds<S>5387</S> and wind<S>7307</S> without rain<S>1653</S>. <sup>of a: Heb. in a gift of falsehood</sup>
By long<S>753</S> forbearing<S>639</S> is a prince<S>7101</S> persuaded<S>6601</S>, and a soft<S>7390</S> tongue<S>3956</S> breaketh<S>7665</S> the bone<S>1634</S>.
Hast thou found<S>4672</S> honey<S>1706</S>? eat<S>398</S> so much as is sufficient<S>1767</S> for thee, lest thou be filled<S>7646</S> therewith, and vomit<S>6958</S> it.
Withdraw<S>3365</S> thy foot<S>7272</S> from thy neighbour's<S>7453</S> house<S>1004</S>; lest he be weary<S>7646</S> of thee, and so hate<S>8130</S> thee. <sup>Withdraw: or, Let thy foot be seldom in</sup> <sup>weary: Heb. full of thee</sup>
A man<S>376</S> that beareth<S>6030</S> false<S>8267</S> witness<S>5707</S> against his neighbour<S>7453</S> is a maul<S>4650</S>, and a sword<S>2719</S>, and a sharp<S>8150</S> arrow<S>2671</S>.
Confidence<S>4009</S> in an unfaithful man<S>898</S> in time<S>3117</S> of trouble<S>6869</S> is like a broken<S>7465</S> tooth<S>8127</S>, and a foot<S>7272</S> out of joint<S>4154</S>.
As he that taketh away<S>5710</S> a garment<S>899</S> in cold<S>7135</S> weather<S>3117</S>, and as vinegar<S>2558</S> upon nitre<S>5427</S>, so is he that singeth<S>7891</S> songs<S>7892</S> to an heavy<S>7451</S> heart<S>3820</S>.
If thine enemy<S>8130</S> be hungry<S>7457</S>, give him bread<S>3899</S> to eat<S>398</S>; and if he be thirsty<S>6771</S>, give him water<S>4325</S> to drink<S>8248</S>:
For thou shalt heap<S>2846</S> coals of fire<S>1513</S> upon his head<S>7218</S>, and the LORD<S>3068</S> shall reward<S>7999</S> thee.
The north<S>6828</S> wind<S>7307</S> driveth away<S>2342</S> rain<S>1653</S>: so doth an angry<S>2194</S> countenance<S>6440</S> a backbiting<S>5643</S> tongue<S>3956</S>. <sup>driveth: or, bringeth forth rain: so doth a backbiting tongue an angry countenance</sup>
It is better<S>2896</S> to dwell<S>3427</S> in the corner<S>6438</S> of the housetop<S>1406</S>, than with a brawling<S>4079</S> <S>4066</S> woman<S>802</S> and in a wide<S>2267</S> house<S>1004</S>.
As cold<S>7119</S> waters<S>4325</S> to a thirsty<S>5889</S> soul<S>5315</S>, so is good<S>2896</S> news<S>8052</S> from a far<S>4801</S> country<S>776</S>.
A righteous<S>6662</S> man falling down<S>4131</S> before<S>6440</S> the wicked<S>7563</S> is as a troubled<S>7515</S> fountain<S>4599</S>, and a corrupt<S>7843</S> spring<S>4726</S>.
It is not good<S>2896</S> to eat<S>398</S> much<S>7235</S> honey<S>1706</S>: so for men to search<S>2714</S> their own glory<S>3519</S> is not glory<S>3519</S>.
He<S>376</S> that hath no rule<S>4623</S> over his own spirit<S>7307</S> is like a city<S>5892</S> that is broken down<S>6555</S>, and without walls<S>2346</S>.
